text: working with AWS in itself is easy
there's no complexity but at my level it
just works there are huge benefits to
working with AWS and I would implore
anyone to consider it in their
architectural plans and my name is Andy
Sutton I'm the founder and chief
executive of click that in the UK click
that is an an e-commerce company but
it's an e-commerce company with a
difference uh we use a New Concept which
we like to call collaborative auctions
everyone understands a normal auction
where people bid against each other and
drive the price up and there ends up
being one winner who pays the most
that's great but I've always thought
well actually there's a big missed
opportunity there because for every one
winner you have there are any number of
people who are ready to buy hands in
their pocket but we haven't been able to
sell to them click that effectively
addresses that lost Market we engage
with consumers we ask them what they
would like to pay for products we aggre
gate demand and then we give the
retailer the the luxury of selecting
their price points based on the volume
of that demand our customers are UK
retail consumers we're working
specifically with Barkley's customers at
the moment and on the other side of the
equation we work very closely with
suppliers who provide product into the
platform my team um is is has lots of
different functions so I have a core
operational team that runs the platform
on a on a day-to-day basis
I will then have a customer service team
that handles obviously all the customer
queries that come in and we have a
marketing capability as well about 12
months ago um we were evaluating the
architecture with which we were going to
take the uh the platform live in
conjunction with with Barkley's and up
until that point we we'd gone down a
more of a traditional architecture type
route and we started to see the
limitations of that in terms of
scalability but then we thought well
actually we should really be exploring a
cloud-based solution to do this the
costs for doing it through a cloud-based
environment were probably around about
30% of what they would have been through
a traditional architecture we use ec2 as
the core of the platform and that gives
us the flexible scalability that AB
absolutely essential to the operation
then we use S3 for really important
things like images and videos to make
sure that we can stream those
efficiently effectively quickly we then
use the greatly named Route 53 for our
RDS routing and that makes sure that
everything is rooted effectively to the
right the right part uh of the
architecture we're a technology business
that is underpinned by AWS so everything
that we that we bring to Market is
fundamentally reliant on AWS so it sits
right at the heart of what we do the ad
support team of course are very happy to
answer all the technical questions that
my guys bring to them um through the
development and the support process but
it doesn't stop there and the thing that
my guys really welcome is the proactive
nature of AWS support it's really
powerful and it really helps us when I
look at what AWS is doing for the back
end of the market the infrastructure
Market it's doing exactly the same thing
it simplifies things for the businesses
that deploy it and what does that mean
to me it means I don't have to worry
about things we can focus on growing our
business making click that a success
rather than the nuts and bolts that are
sitting behind it
[Music]
